intro: Daboecia polifolia, commonly known as the coastal heath, is a flowering plant native to the western and southern coasts of South Africa. It is a member of the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal fynbos vegetation. It is well adapted to coastal conditions, including salt spray and strong winds. Daboecia polifolia plays an important ecological role in stabilizing coastal dunes and providing habitat for various insects and birds.
